elements.description: Check if Google Play Services are available & ready on the device.
elements.examples:
if gpgs then
  local is_supported = gpgs.is_supported()
end
elements.name: gpgs.is_supported

returnvalues.doc: Status of Google Play Services on the device.
returnvalues.name: boolean

elements.description: Login to GPGS using a button.
elements.examples:
Log in to GPGS using a button:

if gpgs then
  gpgs.login()
end
elements.name: gpgs.login

elements.description:
Silent login to GPGS.
This function is trying to retrieve the currently signed-in player’s account.
[icon:attention] By default login methods request `GoogleSignInOptions.DEFAULT_GAMES_SIGN_IN`. But if you use Disk, we have to request extra scope `Drive.SCOPE_APPFOLDER`. Or if you use ID token, we have to request ID token with provided client_id. If so it causes the first time silent sign-in to fail, except for users who have already signed in successfully on a different device. Turn off GPGS features you don't want to use in `game.project`.
elements.examples:
function init(self)
  if gpgs then
    gpgs.silent_login()
  end
end
elements.name: gpgs.silent_login

elements.description: Logout from GPGS
elements.examples:
if gpgs then
  gpgs.logout()
end
elements.name: gpgs.logout

elements.description: Get the current GPGS player display name.
elements.examples:
if gpgs then
  local name = gpgs.get_display_name()
end
elements.name: gpgs.get_display_name

elements.description: Get the current GPGS player id.
elements.examples:
if gpgs then
  local id = gpgs.get_id()
end
elements.name: gpgs.get_id

elements.description: Get the current GPGS player id token. Available only if "gpgs.client_id" is configured in game.project and "gpgs.request_id_token = 1".
elements.examples:
if gpgs then
  local id_token = gpgs.get_id_token()
end
elements.name: gpgs.get_id_token

elements.description: Returns a one-time server auth code to send to your web server which can be exchanged for access token
elements.examples:
if gpgs then
  local server_auth_code = gpgs.get_server_auth_code()
end
elements.name: gpgs.get_server_auth_code

returnvalues.doc: The server auth code for logged in account.
returnvalues.name: string

elements.description: Check if a user is logged in currently.
elements.examples:
if gpgs then
  local is_loggedin = gpgs.is_logged_in()
end
elements.name: gpgs.is_logged_in

elements.description: This method sets the position for the login popup.
elements.examples:
if gpgs then
  gpgs.set_popup_position(gpgs.POPUP_POS_BOTTOM_CENTER)
end
elements.name: gpgs.set_popup_position

parameters.doc:
An position can be one of the predefined constants below
- `gpgs.POPUP_POS_TOP_LEFT`
- `gpgs.POPUP_POS_TOP_CENTER`
- `gpgs.POPUP_POS_TOP_RIGHT`
- `gpgs.POPUP_POS_CENTER_LEFT`
- `gpgs.POPUP_POS_CENTER`
- `gpgs.POPUP_POS_CENTER_RIGHT`
- `gpgs.POPUP_POS_BOTTOM_LEFT`
- `gpgs.POPUP_POS_BOTTOM_CENTER`
- `gpgs.POPUP_POS_BOTTOM_RIGHT`

Default value is `gpgs.POPUP_POS_TOP_CENTER`
parameters.name: position

elements.description: Set callback for receiving messages from GPGS.
elements.examples:
function callback(self, message_id, message)
  if message_id == gpgs.MSG_SIGN_IN or message_id == gpgs.MSG_SILENT_SIGN_IN then
    if message.status == gpgs.STATUS_SUCCESS then
    -- do something after login
    end
  elseif message_id == gpgs.MSG_SIGN_OUT then
  -- do something after logout
  elseif message_id == gpgs.MSG_LOAD_SNAPSHOT then
  -- do something when a save was loaded
  end
end

function init(self)
  gpgs.set_callback(callback)
end

function init(self)
  gpgs.set_callback(nil) -- remove callback
end
elements.name: gpgs.set_callback

parameters.doc: A callback taking the following parameters
parameters.name: callback

parameters.doc: The calling script
parameters.name: self

parameters.doc:
An message_id can be one of the predefined constants below
- `gpgs.MSG_SIGN_IN`
- `gpgs.MSG_SILENT_SIGN_IN`
- `gpgs.MSG_SIGN_OUT`
- `gpgs.MSG_SHOW_SNAPSHOTS`
- `gpgs.MSG_LOAD_SNAPSHOT`
- `gpgs.MSG_SAVE_SNAPSHOT`
parameters.name: message_id

parameters.doc: Contains information that depends on message_id.
parameters.name: message

parameters.doc:
Status of the current operation. It can be one of the predefined constants below
- `gpgs.STATUS_SUCCESS`
- `gpgs.STATUS_FAILED`
- `gpgs.STATUS_CREATE_NEW_SAVE`
- `gpgs.STATUS_CONFLICT`
parameters.name: status

parameters.doc: The error message. Available only if `status` is `gpgs.STATUS_FAILED`.
parameters.name: error

parameters.doc:
The error code. Available only if `status` is `gpgs.STATUS_FAILED` and GPGS provide this code. It can be one of the predefined constants below
- `gpgs.ERROR_STATUS_SNAPSHOT_COMMIT_FAILED`
- `gpgs.ERROR_STATUS_SNAPSHOT_CONFLICT_MISSING`
- `gpgs.ERROR_STATUS_SNAPSHOT_CONTENTS_UNAVAILABLE`
- `gpgs.ERROR_STATUS_SNAPSHOT_CREATION_FAILED`
- `gpgs.ERROR_STATUS_SNAPSHOT_FOLDER_UNAVAILABLE`
- `gpgs.ERROR_STATUS_SNAPSHOT_NOT_FOUND`
Or it can be ApiException.getStatusCode() (if ApiException was thrown)
parameters.name: error_status

parameters.doc: Metadata of the loaded save. Available only if `message_id` is `gpgs.MSG_LOAD_SNAPSHOT`.
parameters.name: metadata

parameters.doc: The conflict id. Available only if `status` is `gpgs.STATUS_CONFLICT`.
parameters.name: conflictId

parameters.doc: The conflicting metadata. Available only if `status` is `gpgs.STATUS_CONFLICT`.
parameters.name: conflictMetadata

elements.description: Provides a default saved games selection user interface.
elements.examples:
if gpgs then
  gpgs.snapshot_display_saves("Choose the save of the game", false, true, 10)
end
elements.name: gpgs.snapshot_display_saves

parameters.doc: The title to display in the action bar. By default "Game Saves".
parameters.name: popupTitle

parameters.doc: Whether or not to display a "create new snapshot" option in the selection UI. By default `true`.
parameters.name: allowAddButton

parameters.doc: Whether or not to provide a delete overflow menu option for each snapshot in the selection UI. By default `true`.
parameters.name: allowDelete

parameters.doc: The maximum number of snapshots to display in the UI. By default 5.
parameters.name: maxNumberOfSavedGamesToShow

elements.description: Opens a snapshot with the given `saveName`. If `createIfNotFound` is set to `true`, the specified snapshot will be created if it does not already exist.
elements.examples:
if gpgs then
  gpgs.snapshot_open("my_save_1", true, gpgs.RESOLUTION_POLICY_LONGEST_PLAYTIME)
end
elements.name: gpgs.snapshot_open

parameters.doc: The name of the snapshot file to open. Must be between 1 and 100 non-URL-reserved characters (a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or the symbols "-", ".", "_", or "~").
parameters.name: saveName

parameters.doc: If `true`, the snapshot will be created if one cannot be found.
parameters.name: createIfNotFound

parameters.doc:
The conflict resolution policy to use for this snapshot that can be one of the predefined constants below
- `gpgs.RESOLUTION_POLICY_MANUAL`
- `gpgs.RESOLUTION_POLICY_LONGEST_PLAYTIME`
- `gpgs.RESOLUTION_POLICY_LAST_KNOWN_GOOD`
- `gpgs.RESOLUTION_POLICY_MOST_RECENTLY_MODIFIED`
- `gpgs.RESOLUTION_POLICY_HIGHEST_PROGRESS`

Default value is `gpgs.RESOLUTION_POLICY_LAST_KNOWN_GOOD`
parameters.name: conflictPolicy

elements.description: Save the currently opened save on the server and close it.
elements.examples:
if gpgs then
  local png_img, w, h = screenshot.png()
  gpgs.snapshot_commit_and_close({
      coverImage = png_img,
      description = "LEVEL 31, CAVE",
      playedTime = 12345667,
      progressValue = 657
  })
end
elements.name: gpgs.snapshot_commit_and_close

parameters.doc: A table with metadata for a save. It contains the fields below
parameters.name: metadata

parameters.doc: The new played time to set for the snapshot in ms.
parameters.name: playedTime

parameters.doc: The new progress value to set for the snapshot.
parameters.name: progressValue

parameters.doc: The new description to set for the snapshot.
parameters.name: description

parameters.doc: The new cover image to set for the snapshot in `png`.
parameters.name: coverImage

elements.description: Returns the currently opened snapshot data.
elements.examples:
if gpgs then
  local bytes, error_message = gpgs.snapshot_get_data()
  if not bytes then
      print("snapshot_get_data ERROR:", error_message)
  else
      print("snapshot_get_data",bytes)
      -- Do something with your data
  end
end
elements.name: gpgs.snapshot_get_data

returnvalues.doc: The byte array data of the currently opened snapshot. `nil` if something goes wrong.
returnvalues.name: string

returnvalues.doc: An error message if something goes wrong.
returnvalues.name: string

elements.description: Sets the data for the currently opened snapshot.
elements.examples:
if gpgs then
    local success, error_message = gpgs.snapshot_set_data(my_data)
    if not success then
        print("snapshot_set_data ERROR:", error_message)
    end
  end
elements.name: gpgs.snapshot_set_data

parameters.doc: The data to set.
parameters.name: data

returnvalues.doc: True if data was set for the currently opened snapshot.
returnvalues.name: boolean

returnvalues.doc: An error message if something goes wrong.
returnvalues.name: string

elements.description: Check if a snapshot was opened.
elements.examples:
if gpgs then
  local is_opened = gpgs.snapshot_is_opened()
end
elements.name: gpgs.snapshot_is_opened

elements.description: Returns the maximum data size per snapshot cover image in bytes.
elements.examples:
if gpgs then
  local image_size = gpgs.snapshot_get_max_image_size()
end
elements.name: gpgs.snapshot_get_max_image_size

returnvalues.doc: The maximum data size per snapshot cover image in bytes.
returnvalues.name: number

elements.description: Returns the maximum data size per snapshot in bytes.
elements.examples:
if gpgs then
  local data_size = gpgs.snapshot_get_max_save_size()
end
elements.name: gpgs.snapshot_get_max_save_size

returnvalues.doc: The maximum data size per snapshot in bytes.
returnvalues.name: number

elements.description: Returns the conflicting snapshot data.
elements.examples:
if gpgs then
  local bytes, error_message = gpgs.snapshot_get_conflicting_data()
  if not bytes then
      print("snapshot_get_conflicting_data ERROR:", error_message)
  else
      print("snapshot_get_conflicting_data:",bytes)
      -- Do something with conflicting data data
  end
end
elements.name: gpgs.snapshot_get_conflicting_data

returnvalues.doc: The byte array data of the conflicting snapshot. `nil` if something goes wrong.
returnvalues.name: string

returnvalues.doc: An error message if something goes wrong.
returnvalues.name: boolean

elements.description: Resolves a conflict using the data from the provided snapshot.
elements.examples:
if gpgs then
  gpgs.snapshot_resolve_conflict(self.conflictId, gpgs.SNAPSHOT_CONFLICTING)
end
elements.name: gpgs.snapshot_resolve_conflict

parameters.doc: The conflict id that you want to resolve. Provided in `message` table with `STATUS_CONFLICT` message type.
parameters.name: conflictId

parameters.doc:
Type of the snapshot you want to use for conflict solving that can be one of the predefined constants below
- `gpgs.SNAPSHOT_CURRENT`
- `gpgs.SNAPSHOT_CONFLICTING`
parameters.name: snapshotId

elements.description: Official [GPGS documentation](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/SnapshotsClient.html#RESOLUTION_POLICY_MANUAL) for this constant
elements.name: RESOLUTION_POLICY_MANUAL

elements.description: The message type that GPGS sends when finishing the asynchronous operation after calling `gpgs.login()`
elements.name: MSG_SIGN_IN

elements.description: The message type that GPGS sends when finishing the asynchronous operation after calling `gpgs.silent_login()`
elements.name: MSG_SILENT_SIGN_IN

elements.description: The message type that GPGS sends when finishing the asynchronous operation after calling `gpgs.logout()`
elements.name: MSG_SIGN_OUT

elements.description: The message type that GPGS sends when finishing the asynchronous operation after calling `gpgs.snapshot_display_saves()`
elements.name: MSG_SHOW_SNAPSHOTS

elements.description: The message type that GPGS sends when finishing the asynchronous operation after calling `gpgs.snapshot_open()`
elements.name: MSG_LOAD_SNAPSHOT

elements.description: The message type that GPGS sends when finishing the asynchronous operation after calling `gpgs.snapshot_commit_and_close()`
elements.name: MSG_SAVE_SNAPSHOT

elements.description: An operation success.
elements.name: STATUS_SUCCESS

elements.description: An operation failed. Check the error field in the massage table.
elements.name: STATUS_FAILED

elements.description: A user wants to create new save as a result of `gpgs.snapshot_display_saves()` method. Turn off this button in `gpgs.snapshot_display_saves()` if you don't want to have this functionality.
elements.name: STATUS_CREATE_NEW_SAVE

elements.description: The result of the calling `gpgs.snapshot_open()` or 'gpgs.snapshot_resolve_conflict()' is a conflict. You need to make decision on how to solve this conflict using 'gpgs.snapshot_resolve_conflict()'.
elements.name: STATUS_CONFLICT

elements.description: The second parameter for 'gpgs.snapshot_resolve_conflict()' method, which means that you want to choose the current snapshot as a snapshot for conflict solving.
elements.name: SNAPSHOT_CURRENT

elements.description: The second parameter for 'gpgs.snapshot_resolve_conflict()' method, which means that you want to choose the conflicting snapshot as a snapshot for conflict solving.
elements.name: SNAPSHOT_CONFLICTING

elements.description: This constant is used in `message.error_status` table when `MSG_LOAD_SNAPSHOT` is `STATUS_FAILED`. [Official GPGS documentation](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/GamesStatusCodes.html#STATUS_SNAPSHOT_NOT_FOUND) for this constant
elements.name: ERROR_STATUS_SNAPSHOT_NOT_FOUND

elements.description: This constant is used in `message.error_status` table when `MSG_LOAD_SNAPSHOT` is `STATUS_FAILED`. [Official GPGS documentation](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/GamesStatusCodes.html#STATUS_SNAPSHOT_CREATION_FAILED) for this constant
elements.name: ERROR_STATUS_SNAPSHOT_CREATION_FAILED

elements.description: This constant is used in `message.error_status` table when `MSG_LOAD_SNAPSHOT` is `STATUS_FAILED`. [Official GPGS documentation](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/GamesStatusCodes.html#STATUS_SNAPSHOT_CONTENTS_UNAVAILABLE) for this constant
elements.name: ERROR_STATUS_SNAPSHOT_CONTENTS_UNAVAILABLE

elements.description: This constant is used in `message.error_status` table when `MSG_LOAD_SNAPSHOT` is `STATUS_FAILED`. [Official GPGS documentation](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/GamesStatusCodes.html#STATUS_SNAPSHOT_COMMIT_FAILED) for this constant
elements.name: ERROR_STATUS_SNAPSHOT_COMMIT_FAILED

elements.description: This constant is used in `message.error_status` table when `MSG_LOAD_SNAPSHOT` is `STATUS_FAILED`. [Official GPGS documentation](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/GamesStatusCodes.html#STATUS_SNAPSHOT_FOLDER_UNAVAILABLE) for this constant
elements.name: ERROR_STATUS_SNAPSHOT_FOLDER_UNAVAILABLE

elements.description: This constant is used in `message.error_status` table when `MSG_LOAD_SNAPSHOT` is `STATUS_FAILED`. [Official GPGS documentation](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/GamesStatusCodes.html#STATUS_SNAPSHOT_CONFLICT_MISSING) for this constant
elements.name: ERROR_STATUS_SNAPSHOT_CONFLICT_MISSING

info.description: Functions and constants for interacting with Google Play Game Services (GPGS) APIs
info.name: extension-gpgs
